SSDL, the Simple SDL wrapper library.
Copyright 2025, Will Briggs

This is a simple library designed to work with SDL2, SDL2_image, SDL2_mixer, and SDL2_ttf to make programming with SDL easy for beginners.  3rd-party dll's needed by the above libraries, and thus also needed by SSDL, include

Special thanks to various people whose software is used here:

The creators of SDL2.
The creators of SDL2_image, SDL2_mixer, and SDL2_image.
Google, for Noto Sans font.
The creators of several third-party libraries, including:

libavif, by Joe Drago, with assistance from VideoLAN and dav1d authors, and Emanuel Gil Peyrot
libgme, by Balló György
libogg, by Xiph.org
libopus, by Xiph.Org, Skype Limited, Octasic, Jean-Marc Valin, Timothy B. Terriberry, CSIRO, Gregory Maxwell, Mark Borgerding, and Erik de Castro Lopo

libwebp, by Google

--

To use with Microsoft Visual Studio, go to <repository>/newWork/basicSSDLProject, make a copy, open the .sln file, and build.
To use with Unix, go to the unix/ subfolder of this folder and make. 
Then go to <repository>/newWork/basicSSDLProject, make a copy, go into the folder, and make.

For a more detailed explanation see the appendices of _C++26 for Lazy Programmers_.
